intro: Rubus rusticanus f. anchostachys, commonly known as the Anchostachys raspberry, is a botanical variant of the raspberry plant characterized by its unique floral and fruiting structures. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is native to certain regions of Europe. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when ripe, similar to other raspberry species. Its leaves are trifoliate, with serrated edges, and it thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its distinct morphological traits and potential for horticultural use.
